content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) that smelts iron ore into iron plates.
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) that stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) that extracts iron ore.
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) that transfers ore from the extraction point.
– Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) that delivers extracted ore.
– Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) that stores delivered ore.
– Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) feeding ore to a remote branch.
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) that moves ore along the intermediate belt.
– Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) receiving ore for further routing.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) that smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) processing science packs.
– Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) drawing water.
– Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) supplying steam.
– Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) generating electricity.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) configured for pipe crafting.
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) storing crafted pipes.
– Electricity Network composed of small electric poles linking the production components.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Connection Candidate Not Found Errors  
  – Fluid connection attempts using candidate PipeGroup with fluid_system identifiers [73348, 73490, 73632, 73774, 73916, 74058, 74200, 74342, 74484, 74626, 74768, 74910, 75052, 75194, 75336, 75478, 75620, 75762, 75904, 76046, 76188, 76330, 76472, 76614, 76756, 76898, 77040, 77182, 77324, 77466, 77608, 77750, 77892, 78034, 78176, 78318, 78460, 78602, 78744, 78886, 79028, 79170, 79312, 79454, 79596, 79738, 79880, 80022, 80164, 80306, 80448, 80590, 80732, 80874, 81016, 81158, 81300, 81442, 81584, 81726, 81868, 82010, 82152, 82294, 82436, 82578, 82720, 82862, 83004, 83146, 83288, 83430, 83572, 83714, 83856, 83998, 84140, 84282, 84424, 84566] near (-1.5, 17.5) have failed.  
  – Ensure that the intended candidate PipeGroup is present and properly connected at the specified location before initiating a fluid connection. Failed connection efforts may also affect related entities (for example, boilers and steam engines) by leaving them without the necessary input liquid.

• Manual Pipe Placement Issues  
  – Confirm that the target tile is unoccupied prior to placement.

• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections  
  – Verify that all required pipes and components are available before attempting a connection.

• Crafting Sub-Ingredient Limitations  
  – Maintain sufficient stocks of sub-ingredients to support assembling machine operations.

• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues  
  – Connect assembling machines to a stable power network and ensure that the inventory supplies the needed resources (for example, having enough iron plates to facilitate pipe creation).

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  Retrieves an entity of the specified type at a given position; returns the entity on success or raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct its alignment during placement.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  Inserts a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory; returns the updated target on success or raises an exception if unavailable.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection between a virtual candidate and the boiler’s connection point; raises an exception if conditions are not met.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply at (2.5, 19.5).
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input at (5.5, 5.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
